solution_line_template: Since Cory drives his wheelchair at {cory_speed} miles per hour, then Milo rolls downhill on his skateboard at {cory_speed}/{cory_milo_speed_ratio} = <<{cory_speed}/{cory_milo_speed_ratio}={milo_skateboard_speed}>>{milo_skateboard_speed} miles per hour.
Therefore, Milo runs at {milo_skateboard_speed}/{milo_skateboard_run_ratio} = <<{milo_skateboard_speed}/{milo_skateboard_run_ratio}={milo_run_speed}>>{milo_run_speed} miles per hour.

If Milo runs for {run_time} hours at {milo_run_speed} miles per hour, then Milo will travel {run_time} * {milo_run_speed} = <<{run_time}*{milo_run_speed}={milo_run_distance}>>{milo_run_distance} miles.
